item.title: Widefield vs. SPIM
item.author: aaron-zzz@outlook.com (Aaron)
item.description: SPIM: selective plane illumination microscope If we use gaussian beam as illumination light, then the resolution of z axis is limited by the thickness of the beam in z direction. Note that the effective illumination region of the light is in the rayleigh distance, which by the way is proportional to the beam’s waist width^2, namely the thickness^2 of the beam as we mention above. So this distance decides the SPIM’s field of view.
